data.description:
This is my first watchface for PebbleTime. It is inspired by the Utility watchface of the Apple Watch.

Shows:
- digital time
- analog time
- weekday and date
- battery percentage
- Bluetooth disconnect

Options:
- enable/disable second hand
- enable/disable bluetooth status
- select between 5 different watchfaces

No further updates or support... I've sold my Pebble! Sorry.

data.author: Julien Wehrbach

changelog.release_notes:
You can now set your own tracker ! Up to 20 characters, special thanks to Jeff Jessie who gave me this idea :
"are there plans to add any other activities to the tracker? Like days since last "health related" issue. Or something to that "

Please heart it if you love it !

Besides the standard digital clock display, you will be able to track time of specific events.

There're sometimes, things we can be proud of, be it a marriage, stop smoking or many more. Or other kind of events, sad ones, nonetheless milestones in our lives.
This Watchface will help you tracking how much time has passed since those events.

- Configurable event time tracker
- 12 or 24 clock format
- 10 points battery tracking status
- bluetooth connectivity

SquareFont from http://www.dafont.com/squarefont.font

data.description:
Please heart it if you love it !

! Important, you have to uninstall (remove from your library) the old version 1.0 to use the 1.1


Besides the standard digital clock display, you will be able to track time of specific events.

There're sometimes, things we can be proud of, be it a marriage, stop smoking or many more. Or other kind of events, sad ones, nonetheless milestones in our lives.
This Watchface will help you tracking how much time has passed since those events.

- Configurable event time tracker 
- You can now set custom tracker, up to 20 characters 
- 12 or 24 clock format
- 10 points battery tracking status

SquareFont from http://www.dafont.com/squarefont.font

data.author: Moises Aranas

changelog.release_notes: Added Aplite (OG Pebble and Steel) support! Instead of colors to differentiate the current time zone and the custom time zone, the length of the hands differ - the shorter hour hand is the custom time zone.
Fixed hour hands to move with the minute hand gradually as well.
First verson (1.0)

data.description: NaviTime GMT is an analog watchface that can tell time in 2 different timezones - your current timezone, and a custom offset you set in the settings. It's also easy to tell if it is night/day - the corresponding hour hand turns red at daytime, and blue at nighttime (6am to 6pm). A date indicator is also at the 3-o'clock mark. For OG Pebble and Pebble steel, the colored hands are replaced with hands of different lengths - the shorter hour hand represents the hour at the custom timezone you select.

latest_release.release_notes: Added Aplite (OG Pebble and Steel) support! Instead of colors to differentiate the current time zone and the custom time zone, the length of the hands differ - the shorter hour hand is the custom time zone.

data.title: NaviTime GMT

changelog.release_notes:
New Customization Options!
Color customization, minute/hour ticks, etc.

- Bluetooth monitor

data.description:
An analog watchface with 4 slots for customizable complications, so it can be as basic or as complicated as you want. 

Now includes color customization!

Current list of complications:

- Seconds Dial 
- Day Dial 
- Month Dial 
- Weekday Dial 
- Day Number 
- Logo (Top slot only) 
- Battery Gauge 
- Bluetooth monitor
- Battery icon
- Day name
- Digital time
- Digital date

I will be adding more in the future. Feel free to email me suggestions!

(Removed Aplite (Pebble/Pebble Steel) version until the "graphics_context_set_stroke_width" command works on it. Without that command, the app looks terrible.)

latest_release.release_notes:
New Customization Options!
Color customization, minute/hour ticks, etc.

New Complications:
- Bluetooth monitor
- Battery icon
- Day name
- Digital time
- Digital date

Removed Aplite (Pebble/Pebble Steel) version until the "graphics_context_set_stroke_width" command works on it. Without that command, it looks terrible.

data.title: Complications

data.description:
Inspired by the Neon IO X watchface.  Nine-by-nine grid that fills in with the time.  Reads from inside to out.  Supports both 12-hour and 24-hour formats.  Vibrates on Bluetooth disconnect/reconnect.  Digits formatted similar to 7-segment display, with exception of 8 (two horizontal bars; see images 2 and 3).

Image 1: 02:03
Image 2: 08:18
Image 3: 18:54

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.1: Corrected issue with the zero in the minute's tens place.

data.title: KaMet Nines-H

data.author: Cody Doremus

changelog.release_notes: Added two new date settings to use month abbreviations instead of numbers. ('Fe' vs ' 2')
Reduced size of message between phone and watch.
Added openweathermap.org api key.
Fixed code that was not working with 2.3 release and causing the watchface to freeze when settings or colors updated. Hopefully fixed bug with weather icons sometimes going blank.
Changed update method for settings and color changes based on day/night. Should stop the freezing that started happening with the pebble 2.3 update.
Changed key for temperature communication. This should fix the temperature getting overridden to 0. Still looking for a bug that seems to only happen on a fresh load.

Bug fixes: Through working on an upcoming app I found I was not handling images correctly. Now I am properly checking to make sure I don't create the same image more than once and I only delete images that exist. Hopefully this fixes the behavior that sometimes instead of honoring a button press it stays on the watch and the temperature goes to 0. I will continue to investigate if I manage to get that behavior again.
Centered date information. I think it looks a little better.

User request: added a setting to switch to Day-Month order on the date.

Menu icons and names are being adjusted so that my watchfaces are more easily identifiable. The shrunk screenshot is not super helpful if you are switching between the full to get more information and lite versions to save battery. The menu icon will now have the initials of the Precisioneer type (PC for Precisioneer Color).

Maintenance release. Just changed the defaults on first load to be the same settings that I use (except for my weather underground api key). Hopefully makes the first load look better. I am sure the first thing someone does is get in and change the settings how they want.
Spelling is hard...

Final Final tweaks unless I think of a new idea or somebody else gives me a good suggestion or bugs.

Changed openweathermap request to high low temperature instead of day/night avg temp.
Changed the day/night icon to red up arrow/down blue arrow.
Updated menu icon with new layout, thought it is so small maybe that does not matter.
Added a battery charging icon. Currently not planning any more updates unless people give me good suggestions, I find a bug, or I feel inspired.
Oops.. put the initialization for the red battery icon (20% or less) in the wrong place. Fixed now.

Major Update! Now you can get a free API key for weather underground and vastly improve the quality of your weather reporting!
To get your key go to: 

http://www.wunderground.com/weather/api/d/login.html

More instructions are in the description of the settings page. You will see new icons when you use this free setting!
If you do not have a key you will still get openweathermap.org weather.

Majorly improved loading efficiency and memory usage by only loading images when they are needed.
Improved the reliability of getting weather. The biggest failure was the phone not responding with a location, so now it will keep asking until it gets a response!
Fixed a potential bug where you would get Celsius temperature even if you selected Fahrenheit.

Major overhaul of the calls to internet weather. Now it will not attempt an update if it did so in the last 17 minutes. It will attempt to update when the watchface is loaded and every 20 minutes (at 7, 27, and 47 minutes past the hour). This fixes a bug where weather was called multiple times in a row due to timing issues and should make the weather more reliable. This falls more in line with actually using the timeline so the weather does not attemp to update every time you go back to the watch. Limiting the possible calls during the day also opens up the possibility for calling a more reliable weather provider... Stay tuned for an update.

Added Yellow battery icon @ 40% State of Charge and Red battery icon @ 20% SOC.
Changed the name from the [apparently] trademark infringing "Pebleneer" to [hopefully] not law breaking "Precisioneer."
Shrunk icon to show whole watchface instead of just the corner of the watchface. Text is a little sketchy, but hopefully it gets the point across.

Changed border around night temp icon to black so it matches the rest of the icons.
Cleaned up unnecessary code for saving weather info through a settings change.
Added a screenshot for the image in pebble app.

First Color version! Use "Pebbleneer" for BW, images and settings are optimized.
Optimized images for color version with outlines and transparent backgrounds to make them show up nicely [hopefully] no matter what colors you choose. You can pick different colors for day and night. Use the full 64 color pallet to make this watch work for you!

Improvements over Pebbleneer 1.2 - persistent weather - no more blank screens after the initial load! I originally thought you would come back hours later and the weather would be inaccurate, but I found it is common to go back and forth and sometimes the communication does not straiten out with the phone until the 30 minute update, so now it will load last known good value.
Reduced redundant images, looking to add more detailed weather images in the future.
Fixed a bug where temperature would revert to C if the weather refreshed from a settings change.

So far I have not noticed crashes on the first load. These were happening with regular BW pebble I think because settings web page and weather webpage were being pinged at the same time and the java script could not handle it. Hopefully 3.0 fixed this, otherwise go to a different screen and come back and it should not crash again.

data.description:
Data for those who need to know precisely how you want it. Now in COLOR! Configurable, because everyone is a little different and sometimes picky (see Engineer).
Use Pricisioneer for black/white watches.

Get a free api key to get UndergroundWeather! Instructions on settings page.
Otherwise use openweathermap.org

Settings must have an internet connection. Serial number is on the back of your watch. Thanks to Matt https://setpebble.com/ 

Background & Text Colors different for day & Night! Choose from 64 options each!

Seconds-because you like to be precise (or save battery by turning off)

No leading 0s for date and hours-because they are annoying. Pick Month-Day or Day-Month order.

Numerical Battery level-rounded to the nearest 10 with icons for high, medium, low, and charging.

Bluetooth status with custom short long short vibration for when it goes ??-So you realize you left your phone in the car or on your wireless charger

Choose Forecast on Left (or right) so you can plan what to wear. Current icon and temp in the center so you know what the outside is doing when you are far away from windows (UndergroundWeather "Feels like temperature").  Updated every 20 min. Temperature C or F (setting)

Current City-So you know where your phone thinks it is

Extra time data-A/P, year, or none

Customizable Day Abbreviation-English days not preferred? Need both letters to be capitalized?

Monospaced Font - so all the text is in a predictable place. Free font is VCR_OSD_MONO by Riciery Leal

Give it a heart of you like it!

latest_release.release_notes: Added two new date settings to use month abbreviations instead of numbers. ('Fe' vs ' 2')

data.title: Precisioneer Color

data.author: Renato "Lond" Cerqueira

changelog.release_notes: 1.2 comes with an menu icon, fixed app name in the watch and also bluetooth connection information via an "no bt" icon on the top left part of the screen.
The version 1.1 adds battery indicator and charging status.

First version of Lond's Color Polar Clock.
Shows day of the week, date, hour and minute.

data.description:
Lond's Polar Clock is a watchface that shows the hour and minutes using a polar representation that changes the color according to the time.
Inspired by pixelbreaker's polarclock, nirajsanghvi's pebble polar clock and Jnmattern's Arc.

Features:
* Displays the hour and minutes as a colored (only on pebble time) arc that increases as the time passes
* Displays charging state as an icon in the top right part of the screen
* Displays day of the week
* Displays date with day and month
* When the bluetooth connection is severed, display a little "no bluetooth" symbol at the top left part of the screen

Planned
* More languages for the day of the week and month name

latest_release.release_notes: 1.2 comes with an menu icon, fixed app name in the watch and also bluetooth connection information via an "no bt" icon on the top left part of the screen.

data.title: Lond's Color Polar Clock

changelog.release_notes: The numbers style has been rounded to go better with the rounded corners of the Pebble Time. Nexus is also available now for the Pebble Time Round.

data.description:
Summary: glyphy X shape
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36 (all PT except red, all PTS except gold), 12:59 (gold PTS), 18:25 (all PT except red, all PTS except gold), 20:47 (red PT)

The numbers of Nexus are based on two overlapping squares. Please check the number overview in the preview section! The two hour numbers as well as the two minute numbers themselves are connected and build a longer glyph tha appears cryptic at the first glance. Both glyphs are placed crossing each other, forming an X, that inspired the name. The red Pebble Time and the golden Pebble Time Steel have different number colours. Please check the top of this description.

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: The numbers style has been rounded to go better with the rounded corners of the Pebble Time. Nexus is also available now for the Pebble Time Round.

data.description:
Text watchface that resembles a pantone color sample. The background color changes with every passing minute.


Shake your wrist to swap between time and date.


The selected color comes from the binary representation of the current minute. By ignoring Black, Dark Gray, Light Gray, and White we are left with a total of 60 pretty colors for each hour.

latest_release.release_notes: Detect wrist flick to swap between time and date.

data.description:
Quadrant

A futuristic digital watchface.

Numbers are built from segments of rings forming sci-fi glyphs that are recognisable as digits - hours above minutes.

12 or 24 hour format, based on the watch settings.

There is a choice of colors for the digits on the settings screen.


Screenshots show:  
(1) 09:26 - dark red
(2) 21:14 - mid-blue, 24-hour format
(3) 09:12 - violet
(4) 01:03 - cyan
(5) 12:47 - green (with Quick View)


This watchface design was created by Peter Fletcher, from the UK, and is published with the designer's permission.   

To see other watchfaces designed by Peter, including ones for Tokyoflash, along with others from the Tokyoflash Design Studio sanctioned by Tokyoflash, click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.  Configuration changed to use Pebble Clay (can change settings when phone offline).

data.description:
Inspired by the Neon IO X watchface.  Nine-by-nine grid that fills in with the time.  Reads from inside to out.  Supports both 12-hour and 24-hour formats.  Vibrates on Bluetooth disconnect/reconnect.  Digits formatted similar to 7-segment display, with exception of 8 (two horizontal bars; see images 2 and 3).

Image 1: 02:03
Image 2: 08:18
Image 3: 18:54

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.2: Fixed issue with ones in the hour's ones place (code mix-up with Nines-H watchface).

data.title: KaMet Nines

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: cryptic 45° lines
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:34, 12:59, 20:47

The numbers of LNG are made of lines, that come from outside the display and leave it when the job is done. Whenever necessary, these lines sharply bend about 45° to form a more or less abstract number. The abstraction gives the whole display a cryptic sci-fi look. It takes a bit to get used to the numbers, but that's the deal ;) 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: LNG

data.author: KristofWillen

changelog.release_notes:
- upgraded to latest SDK3 release
- hour accuracy readings should be way better now
- configurable hands colors for Pebble Time
- disabled invert option for Pebble OG, as current implementation is deprecated

Version 2.10:
- Better accuracy for hour hand
- Increased readability for Pebble Time users
- Reverted to previous hand form

Version 2.0 :
- Add option for Pebble OG/Steel to invert

Version 1.21 :
- Increase battery readout from 1h to every 10 minutes (usefull while charging watch)

Version 1.20
- Add date indicator
- Tweaks for more accurate time/battery readings
- Only check battery once per hour

Version 1.10 :
- better hour backplate
- better gauge dials for hour/min so it resembles more the Maxspeed watch
- minor enhancements to hour/am/fuel dials 
- tweaks for better placement of the hour dial 

The hour dial still needs further correction.

Version 1.2 :
- Fix an issue with AM/PM gauge

Version 1.1 :
- Improved background dials

data.description: Watchface based on the Max Speed Speedometer watch.  Car gauges everywhere.  This watchfaces features 2 large gauges for hour and minutes, 2 smaller gauges for the AM/PM and battery indicators.

latest_release.release_notes:

- hour accuracy readings should be way better now
- configurable hands colors for Pebble Time
- disabled invert option for Pebble OG, as current implementation is deprecated

data.description:
Union

Set on the Union Jack, blocks appear to tell the time on the main red cross.  Hours from top to bottom, 10-minutes on the left and the 9 single minutes on the right. Count the blocks.

Additional features:
- battery level from top left to bottom right
- bluetooth connected if blocks appear, bottom left to top right
- AM or PM
- Day of week and day of month


Screenshots:  
(1)   7:16AM, Sat 1, battery 60% 
(2) 12:59AM, Wed 29, 40% 
(3)   9:28PM, Fri 31, 100%
(4)   7:55AM, Sat 1, 80%, no bluetooth   
(5)  11:55PM, Sun 8, 80% (with Quick View)


This watchface design was created by Peter Fletcher, from the UK, and is published with the designer's permission.   

To see watchfaces based on designs from the Tokyoflash Design Studio sanctioned by Tokyoflash, including those from Peter, click on "More from this Developer".

data.description:
for Pebble Time latest Firmware.

I thing that must be most conscious in the display of the watch was minute.
In order to visualize the hour,dividing 24 hours by 4 sides.
A day Beginning from left below brick. 
It's increasing to the top from there.
I think most people may generally live as follows.
The brick in the left indicates sleeping time.
The brick in the top indicates before noon.
The brick in the right indicates after noon.
The brick in the bottom indicates time of night.

v1.4 The way of indication was changed. When a bluetooth stste change,it vibrates.
v1.3 name change 24hr-Bricks use custom font add back color and some bugfix 
v1.2 4 backcolor selectable by swing watch. axis x direction is increase. and axis y direction is decrease.

data.author: RCY

changelog.release_notes: • Display forecast 24 hours.
• Support Pebble 2.
• Adjust appearance.

• Fix leading zero setting bug.
• Revert to SDK 4.2 and delete quiet mode (for FW 4.2).
• Change temparature digit color to Entire fore color.
• Fix not responding bug.

• Additional fonts.
• Add leading zero option.
• Fixed a bug that failed to acquire weather data.
• Fixed a problem that background color was not drawn when watchface was switched.

• Smooth font.
• Modifiable date display.

• Adjust appearance.
• Improved motion detection processing for hourly vibe.
• Support quiet time.
• Add second hand display when tapping option.
• Fixed that the temperature display becomes "...".
• Add second digits option (beta).

• Add delay to the display of bluetooth disconnect message when returning from menu.
• Adjust so that letters do not overlap when city name is long.
• Embed the image of the setting page locally.
• Change configuration pages to Clay.
• Fix settings page connection problem.
• Fix communication at API key specified.
• Improve communication.
• Add wind speed unit (m/s).

data.description:
Shows a lot of information at a glance.

•Weather forecast of the next 24 hours with trend chart.

  Temperature or Feelslike : shows in color dots.
  
  Probability of Precipitation : Vertical bar (Cyan)
  
  UV index : Vertical bar (Magenta)

  Sunrise / Sunset : Both horizontal line(orange and blue)

  Wind speed and direction(ex: from the south east at 6 kph).

•3 weeks of calendar with remaining battery and 10 days forecast.
  (Green line: Indicates cable unplugged to battery empty)
  (Yellow: sunny, Gray: cloudy, Cyan: rain, White: snow)

•Bluetooth connection indicator.

•Display the second hand in the option.

•Daytime / Night indicator.
  (Daytime : { Left side : Sunrise, Center : Noon, Right side : Sunset }, with current weather icon)
  (Night : { Left side : Sunset, Right side : Sunrise }, with age of moon)
data.title: ForecasWatch
